content.raw:
@caguero we use the attached configuration. Which is not the same as yours.

Our orientation matches the same 90degree rotation as the iRobot hands so our planning code can be a bit more general.
If you think of the single fingers as thumbs that places them closest to the robot in BDI's default posture.

I think that that would match WPI's way of doing it (@mdedonato 's team)

[http://people.csail.mit.edu/mfallon/share/2014sep/zero_pose.png](http://people.csail.mit.edu/mfallon/share/2014sep/zero_pose.png)
